text: At the very beginning,
there was always that -- "she can't make it."
And so you were left out, more or less.

I'm quite loud and I'm
quite outspoken.

So whenever I'm outspoken,
the chairman would shout --
"you don't talk unless I ask you to."
So that was one of the challenges then.
Then I realized that it may be

a strength that you have,
that people underestimate

your intelligence, or underestimate
your capabilities.

Because if you fail, then
you have met their criteria
of how they have placed you.
But then if you've actually done it,
you have been more of a competition.

Other challenges were --
most of the deals
and especially when we came back to

a little more growth --
they are being done

over a drink or over golf or over anything
between the men, which I don't do.

So I don't go to the parties
or have the drinks and I don't do golf.

I go home at 4:00pm because
I have to pick up my kids
and go home and start again.

So that was really a challenge
because you would actually do
the whole idea and create the whole thing.

Then you would give the idea
to the bank or the client that you want,

and then he you would just give it
to another investment banker
because of the boys' club, as we say.
